channel.title: World : NPR
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Several nations pause funding to UNRWA over alleged staff involvement in Hamas attack
item.description: The U.N. agency charged with providing relief to Palestinians has fired several employees over their alleged involvement in the Oct. 7 attack in Israel.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: The U.N. agency charged with providing relief to Palestinians has fired several employees over their alleged involvement in the Oct. 7 attack in Israel.

item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: The State Department allows the sale of F-16 jets to Turkey to move forward
item.description: The sale of the 40 F-16 fighter jets and upgrades to dozens of other jets became linked to Sweden's accession to NATO, after Turkey had objected.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
The sale of the 40 F-16 fighter jets and upgrades to dozens of other jets became linked to Sweden's accession to NATO, after Turkey had objected.

(Image credit: Javier Torres/AFP via Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Gaza's largest remaining hospital is near collapse, Doctors Without Borders says
item.description: Gaza's largest remaining hospital in Khan Younis can no longer provide critical medical aid to Palestinians, the medical charity group says.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
Gaza's largest remaining hospital in Khan Younis can no longer provide critical medical aid to Palestinians, the medical charity group says.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Her son was taken by Hamas. She threw him a concert in the hopes he could hear it
item.description: Alon Ohel was taken in the early hours of Oct. 7. He is a talented pianist, and his mother believes that music can keep them connected: "It's not the hearing — it's the vibe, it's the energy."

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
Alon Ohel was taken in the early hours of Oct. 7. He is a talented pianist, and his mother believes that music can keep them connected: "It's not the hearing — it's the vibe, it's the energy."

(Image credit: Tamir Kalifa for NPR)

item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: On Holocaust Remembrance Day, a look at how Germany remembers the past
item.description: Germany devotes enormous resources to educating school children about the Holocaust, antisemitism, and discrimination. Despite that, antisemitic and anti-immigrant rhetoric has increased.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: Germany devotes enormous resources to educating school children about the Holocaust, antisemitism, and discrimination. Despite that, antisemitic and anti-immigrant rhetoric has increased.

item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange blame for a plane carrying Ukrainian prisoners being shot
item.description: Ukraine and Russia are blaming each other for the downing of a Russian military transport plane this week, which Russia says had 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war aboard. All aboard were killed.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: Ukraine and Russia are blaming each other for the downing of a Russian military transport plane this week, which Russia says had 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war aboard. All aboard were killed.

item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: ICJ finds genocide case against Israel 'plausible', orders it to stop violations
item.description: The International Court of Justice stopped short of ordering a cease-fire in the Israel-Gaza war as part of the genocide case South Africa has brought against Israel.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: The International Court of Justice stopped short of ordering a cease-fire in the Israel-Gaza war as part of the genocide case South Africa has brought against Israel.

item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: An ancient Egyptian temple in New York inspires a Lebanese American musician
item.description: H. Sinno, former lead singer of the pioneering Lebanese rock band Mashrou' Leila, pairs their own history with that of the Metropolitan Museum's Temple of Dendur in their new opera.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
H. Sinno, former lead singer of the pioneering Lebanese rock band Mashrou' Leila, pairs their own history with that of the Metropolitan Museum's Temple of Dendur in their new opera.

(Image credit: Derrick Kakembo /The Metropolitan Museum of Art)

item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: A California community sees a dip in immigration. Where have all the people gone?
item.description: The town of Jacumba, on the California-Mexico border, has experienced a massive influx of migrants. Unofficial detention camps have popped up throughout the community. Then one day, something changed.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
The town of Jacumba, on the California-Mexico border, has experienced a massive influx of migrants. Unofficial detention camps have popped up throughout the community. Then one day, something changed.

(Image credit: Ash Ponders for NPR)

item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Between bombings, Ukrainians find fun (and a sense of normalcy) at a Kyiv ski resort
item.description: A ski resort in Kyiv offers a respite during a war that has lasted nearly two years. "We are looking forward to victory but we cannot put our lives on stop," says a parent who brought her family here.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
A ski resort in Kyiv offers a respite during a war that has lasted nearly two years. "We are looking forward to victory but we cannot put our lives on stop," says a parent who brought her family here.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)

item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Nepal wants its men back from Russia's war in Ukraine after deaths on the front
item.description: Russia recruits Nepali men with promises of citizenship and enticing wages. But after news of at least 10 Nepali troops killed, Nepal's government and families want to bring their soldiers home.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
Russia recruits Nepali men with promises of citizenship and enticing wages. But after news of at least 10 Nepali troops killed, Nepal's government and families want to bring their soldiers home.

(Image credit: Rajneesh Bhandari for NPR)

item.dc:creator: Shalu Yadav

item.title: Crew extinguishes fire on oil tanker hit by Houthi missile off Yemen coast
item.description: The tanker carried Russian-produced naphtha, a flammable oil, drawing Moscow further into a conflict that so far it had blamed on the U.S.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
The tanker carried Russian-produced naphtha, a flammable oil, drawing Moscow further into a conflict that so far it had blamed on the U.S.

(Image credit: Indian Navy via AP)

item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Haitians are desperate after Kenyan court blocks police force deployment
item.description: Uncertainty have been spreading since Friday's ruling, blocking the deployment of a U.N.-backed police force, with violence reaching new records as gangs tighten their grip on Haiti's capital.

content:encoded.#cdata-section:
Uncertainty have been spreading since Friday's ruling, blocking the deployment of a U.N.-backed police force, with violence reaching new records as gangs tighten their grip on Haiti's capital.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph/AP)

item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A dip in unauthorized border crossings has left a California migrant encampment empty
item.description: The community of Jacumba, in California, has been overwhelmed with migrant encampments — as many as a thousand people in dire humanitarian conditions. A few weeks ago, locals say, something changed.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: The community of Jacumba, in California, has been overwhelmed with migrant encampments — as many as a thousand people in dire humanitarian conditions. A few weeks ago, locals say, something changed.

item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day rings different after the Oct. 7 Hamas attack
item.description: Holocaust Remembrance Day comes annually, but this year it hits differently because of the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel. More Jews were killed that day than on any single day since the Holocaust.

content:encoded.#cdata-section: Holocaust Remembrance Day comes annually, but this year it hits differently because of the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel. More Jews were killed that day than on any single day since the Holocaust.

item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose
